@graph.schema:description: Hotel Domain Specification is a domain-specific pattern for annotating hotels and their offers using schema.org vocabulary.
@graph.schema:name: Hotel

sh:property.rdfs:comment: To estimate rating value, we need to know the highest possible rating value.
This property is used to specify the total number of people who provided the rating for an item.
This property is used to specify the actual rating value for an item.
This property is used to specify the resource from which the rating was obtained.
Property is used to provide a short description of where the rating value comes from or how it counts.
Additional or internal identifier for an image.
The URL of an image related to the annotated web page.
URL that provides a directly retrievable instance of the ImageObject.
The height of an image in pixels.
The width of an image in pixels.
Specifies the name of the image copyright owner, which can be a person or organization.
The main image, which should be associated with a hotel. To describe other related images use property"photo".
This property specifies the full name of a language, e.g. English.
This property specifies the formal language code tag expressed in BCP 47, e.g. EN.
This property is used to specify the name of a contact point.
This property specifies the description of a contact point if it's given.

The value of this property should be choosen from the following list of contact types: "customer support", "technical support", "billing support", "bill payment", "sales", "reservations","credit card support", "emergency", "baggage tracking", "roadside assistance","package tracking".
This property specifies the telephone number of a contact point. The property value is required as the main means of communication.
This property specifies the fax number of a contact point if it's given.
This property specifies the email of a contact point. The property value is required as a common means of communication.
This property specifies the URL of a contact point if it has one.
This property specifies the full name of a language, e.g. English.
This property specifies the formal language code tag expressed in BCP 47, e.g. EN.
The property is used to specify the places available in the hotel, such as a bar, restaurant, sauna, etc. You can choose a specific one from subtypes of type Place.
The property is used to specify currencies, which a hotel accept, e.g. EUR.
Property is used to provide a short description of where the rating value comes from.
Property is used to provide a short description of where the rating value comes from or how it counts.
Additional or internal identifier for an image.
The URL of an image related to the annotated web page.
URL that provides a directly retrievable instance of the ImageObject.
The height of an image in pixels.
The width of an image in pixels.
Specifies the name of the image copyright owner, which can be a person or organization.
Property is used to provide a short description of where the rating value comes from.
Property is used to provide a short description of where the rating value comes from or how it counts.
The property is used to link a hotel to other resources, where it presented. It can be social networks, Wikipedia and other resources.
